ticket.title: RFC-0019 ch17 CAC snapshot contract registry hardening

in_scope: Define schema-qualified `contract_object_registry[]` rows for RFC-0019 chapter 17 snapshot objects.
Bind each required object to `schema_id`, `schema_major`, `schema_stable_id`, digest, and canonicalizer tuple fields.
Treat CAC as deterministic RoleSpec context injection substrate by adding RoleSpec/context-pack/selector/budget/run-receipt contract rows.
Specify deterministic CAC validation order for schema resolution, canonicalizer compatibility, signature freshness, digest completeness, and predicate execution.
Define explicit CAC defect classes and compatibility-state refinements (`COMPATIBLE`/`SUSPECT`/`BLOCKED`).
Define Tier2+ freeze/halt escalation behavior for unresolved CAC defects before adjudication deadline.
out_of_scope: Runtime implementation of schema validators or new kernel admission handlers.
Changes to post-RFC-0020 subsystem ownership boundaries.

steps: Map existing chapter 17 snapshot object list to schema-qualified CAC object registry entries.
Add missing object kinds required by RFC-0028/RFC-0029 CAC gate contracts.
Add RoleSpec context-injection object kinds and verify hash linkage to run receipts.
Add explicit CAC defect taxonomy and fail-closed compatibility transitions.
Cross-check schema IDs used in RFC-0028/RFC-0029 against chapter 17 registry coverage.
Validate final ticket references and section anchors.

criteria: REQ-0020 schema-qualified CAC registry requirements are represented in chapter 17.
RFC-0019 chapter 17 snapshot contract surface is schema-qualified rather than object-name-only.
CAC defect classes include schema, canonicalizer, digest, signature, stale-input, and validation-order failures.
Tier2+ behavior explicitly freezes promotion paths and escalates to halt if unresolved by deadline.
RFC-0028 and RFC-0029 CAC gate/predicate schema IDs are represented in chapter 17 registry.
RoleSpec context injection is hash-deterministic and selector-closed for promotion-critical runs.

notes.security:
Missing, stale, ambiguous, or unverifiable CAC inputs are fail-closed for all promotion-critical
paths. Tier2+ ambiguity is not eligible for permissive continuation.
notes.verification:
Verify coverage by diffing schema IDs referenced in RFC-0028/0029 CAC sections against chapter 17
`contract_object_registry[]`.
notes.general:
Governance backfill ticket created because RFC-0019 (pre-RFC-0020) documents were patched to add
CAC hardening semantics.
